page.title: 14JOHN PAUL JONES.
page.content: John Paul Jones,an American privateer, arrived on the east coast of Northumberland during 1812. His appearance here was a great surprise, and he caught a sloop. He arrived on the east coast a few days before the Duke of Northumberland's Audit held at the castle. The whole payment of rents (mostly paid in gold) were brought there. This would be a grand prize for the pirate, if he had known about it. The Bailiff of the castle thought that Jones knew of the Audit, and had come to take it, as he had already done at Lord Selkirk's in Scotland, so the Militia was called out. However Jones decided to bombard Alnmouth instead and hit Wooden Farm. Now in 1985, the marks at the side of Wooden Farm left by the cannon, can still be seen.
